title: Keep Your Pet Warm
description: Provide a warm and cozy sleeping area for your pet, away from cold floors and direct drafts. Use soft blankets or bedding to help them stay warm. Small or short-haired pets may need sweaters during colder days.

title: Dry Properly After Bath
description: After giving your pet a bath in winter, make sure to dry them thoroughly. Wet fur reduces body temperature and increases the risk of cold, coughing, and infections. Use a towel or low-heat dryer if needed.

title: Take Care of Paw Pads
description: Cold weather can cause dryness and cracks on your petâ€™s paw pads. Apply pet-safe paw balm or a small amount of coconut oil to keep them soft and protected. Avoid taking pets out on extremely cold surfaces.

title: Ensure Proper Hydration
description: Pets tend to drink less water during winter, which can lead to dehydration. Offer fresh water multiple times a day and check their bowl regularly. Proper hydration is essential for maintaining body temperature and overall health.
